sen.j: 祭囃子（まつりばやし）は祭の際に演奏される音楽で、邦楽のジャンルの一つ。
sen.e: `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) is music that is performed at festival time and forms a particular genre of musical accompaniment.
`Matsuribayashi' (festival music) is music that is performed at festival time and forms a particular genre of musical accompaniment.
Matsuribayashi' (festival music) is music that is performed at festival time and forms a particular genre of musical accompaniment.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正

sen.j: 単に「はやし」と呼ばれることも多い。
sen.e: `Matsuribayashi' is often simply referred to as 'Hayashi'; musical accompaniment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: `Matsuribayashi' is often simply referred to as 'Hayashi'; musical accompaniment.
Matsuribayashi is often simply referred to as 'Hayashi'; musical accompaniment.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: しかし、ここでは歌舞伎や能、神楽などの舞台芸術に付随する音楽的要素としての「囃子」を含まない。
sen.e: However, elements of musical performances associated with Kabuki, Noh and Shinto are not included within this classification.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, elements of musical performances associated with Kabuki, Noh and Shinto are not included within this classification.
However, elements of musical performances associated with Kabuki, Noh and Shinto are not included within this classification.

sen.j: 祭に付随した音楽について記述する。
sen.e: `Matsuribayashi' describes music that is incidental to festivals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: `Matsuribayashi' describes music that is incidental to festivals.
Matsuribayashi describes music that is incidental to festivals.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 祭囃子は祭に付随する音楽を総称したもので、各地域にあるそれぞれの祭に密着して発展してきたものである。
sen.e: `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) is a general term that refers to music associated with festivals and as such, its development is closely linked with festivals of various regions in Japan.
`Matsuribayashi' (festival music) is a general term that refers to music associated with festivals and as such, its development is closely linked with festivals of various regions in Japan.
Matsuribayashi is a general term that refers to music associated with festivals and as such, its development is closely linked with festivals of various regions in Japan.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、既出のためMatsuribayashiの補足削除

sen.j: そのため、日本全国で同じ曲や楽器構成を指すのではなく、一つの起源に遡ることができるものでもない。
sen.e: For that reason, it does not refer an identical nation-wide repertoire or use of instruments, nor is it possible to trace its roots back to one sole source.
For that reason, it does not refer an identical nation-wide repertoire or use of instruments, nor is it possible to trace its roots back to one sole source.
For that reason, it does not refer an identical nation-wide repertoire or use of instruments, nor is it possible to trace its roots back to one sole source.

sen.j: 曲の内容もその祭の目的や性格、演奏される場面に関連したものである。
sen.e: Repertoire relates to the aims, character and performance space at each festival.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Repertoire relates to the aims, character and performance space at each festival.
Repertoire relates to the aims, character and performance space at each festival.

sen.j: 童謡「村祭り」などでイメージされるような賑やかな雰囲気の曲であるとは限らない。
sen.e: Repertoire is not limited to lively pieces that are evocative of children's songs village fairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Repertoire is not limited to lively pieces that are evocative of children's songs village fairs.
Repertoire is not limited to lively pieces that are evocative of children's songs 'village fairs.'
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを半角に修正、余分なスペース消去、クォーテーション追加

sen.j: 逆に静かでゆっくりとした曲も存在する。
sen.e: In contrast, slow and peaceful pieces also exist.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In contrast, slow and peaceful pieces also exist.
In contrast, slow and peaceful pieces also exist.

sen.j: 太鼓の奏法である複式複打法を用いる演奏形態（組太鼓形式）を祭囃子と呼ぶ地域もある。
sen.e: In some regions the performance style of playing Japanese 'taiko' drums from both sides is included as part of `Matsuribayashi' (festival music).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In some regions the performance style of playing Japanese 'taiko' drums from both sides is included as part of `Matsuribayashi' (festival music).
In some regions the performance style of playing Japanese 'taiko' drums from both sides is included as part of Matsuribayashi.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正、既出のためMatsuribayashiの補足削除

sen.j: 「祭囃子」という言葉であらわされる中にも非常に多種多様な楽曲が存在している。
sen.e: The ｗord `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) has come to refer to an extremely diverse range of musical compositions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The ｗord `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) has come to refer to an extremely diverse range of musical compositions.
The word Matsuribayashi has come to refer to an extremely diverse range of musical compositions.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、全角表記を半角に修正、Matsuribayashiの補足削除

sen.j: 他の邦楽との違いとして祭囃子の奏者は祭りを主催する神社や寺社の氏子や檀家である一般人の場合が多い。
sen.e: As opposed to other forms of traditional Japanese music, performers of `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) are in many cases members of the general public drawn from parishioners and supporters of the temple or shrine hosting the festival.

As opposed to other forms of traditional Japanese music, performers of `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) are in many cases members of the general public drawn from parishioners and supporters of the temple or shrine hosting the festival.

As opposed to other forms of traditional Japanese music, performers of Matsuribayashi are in many cases members of the general public drawn from parishioners and supporters of the temple or shrine hosting the festival.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、既出のためMatsuribayashiの補足削除

sen.j: 他の邦楽にはプロ奏者が存在し、そういった奏者が祭囃子を担当することもあるが、祭囃子に限ってのプロ奏者というのは数が少ない。
sen.e: Professionals are common In many branches of traditional Japanese music and some also participate in `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) performances however, there are few professional performers who limit themselves to `Matsuribayashi' (festival music).

Professionals are common In many branches of traditional Japanese music and some also participate in `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) performances however, there are few professional performers who limit themselves to `Matsuribayashi' (festival music).

Professionals are common in many branches of traditional Japanese music and some also participate in Matsuribayashi performances; however, there are few professional performers who limit themselves to Matsuribayashi.
sen.cmt: In→in に修正、クォーテーション削除、既出のためMatsuribayashiの補足削除、howeverの前にセミコロン追加

sen.j: 兼任する奏者としては、太神楽師や神楽師、邦楽家、神職など。
sen.e: Instrumentalists often perform roles in more than one genre as temple or shrine musicians, traditional Japanese music performers or as Shinto priests etc.
Instrumentalists often perform roles in more than one genre as temple or shrine musicians, traditional Japanese music performers or as Shinto priests etc.
Instrumentalists often perform roles in more than one genre as temple or shrine musicians, traditional Japanese music performers or as Shinto priests etc.

sen.j: 神輿の担ぎ手や山車の引き手にプロがいないのと同じように、氏子や檀家が祭りのために練習をし、祭りのときのみ演奏されてきたものが多いためである。
sen.e: Much as there are no professionals amongst the ranks of individuals who carry portable shrines (`Mikoshi`) at festivals or those who pull festival floats, parishioners and supporters practice for festivals and in many cases limit perform only to those festivals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Much as there are no professionals amongst the ranks of individuals who carry portable shrines (`Mikoshi`) at festivals or those who pull festival floats, parishioners and supporters practice for festivals and in many cases limit perform only to those festivals.

Much as there are no professionals amongst the ranks of individuals who carry Mikoshi (portable shrines) at festivals or those who pull festival floats, parishioners and supporters practice for festivals and in many cases limit perform only to those festivals.

sen.j: 地域に根付いて伝承されてきた音楽であるという特徴のためである。
sen.e: As such， a particular feature of such music is its regional roots and handing down to others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As such， a particular feature of such music is its regional roots and handing down to others.
As such, a particular feature of such music is its regional roots and handing down to others.
sen.cmt: 全角表記を半角に修正

sen.j: また、地域によっては奏者が少年少女に限られる場合もある。
sen.e: Also, depending on the region, performers are in some cases limited to being young boys and girls.
Also, depending on the region, performers are in some cases limited to being young boys and girls.
Also, depending on the region, performers are in some cases limited to being young boys and girls.

sen.j: 使用する楽器は、和楽器である。
sen.e: The instruments used are traditional Japanese instruments.
The instruments used are traditional Japanese instruments.
The instruments used are traditional Japanese instruments.

sen.j: その中でも笛（篠笛・能管・龍笛など）、和太鼓（中音の打楽器を担当する締太鼓や、低音の打楽器を担当する大太鼓や大胴、そのほか大拍子、団扇太鼓、担ぎ太鼓など）、鉦（摺鉦・当たり鉦、高音の打楽器を担当する）の3種が多い。
sen.e: Even amongst these, 3 types of instrument are prevalent: the flute (high and medium pitched transverse bamboo flutes, Noh flutes etc), traditional drums (mid-range `Taiko` drums keeping beat as well as other large drums, fan drums and carried drums etc), and gongs, (made of metal, percussion instruments with a high register).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Even amongst these, 3 types of instrument are prevalent: the flute (high and medium pitched transverse bamboo flutes, Noh flutes etc), traditional drums (mid-range `Taiko` drums keeping beat as well as other large drums, fan drums and carried drums etc), and gongs, (made of metal, percussion instruments with a high register).

Even amongst these, three types of instrument are prevalent: the flute (high and medium pitched transverse bamboo flutes, Noh flutes etc), traditional drums (mid-range 'Taiko' drums keeping beat as well as other large drums, fan drums and carried drums etc), and gongs, (made of metal, percussion instruments with a high register).
sen.cmt: "3"をスペルアウト、クォーテーション修正

sen.j: しかし、地域によっては弦楽器などを取り入れるところもある。
sen.e: Hoｗeｖer， deｐeding onthe region, stringed instruments etc are also incorporated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Hoｗeｖer， deｐeding onthe region, stringed instruments etc are also incorporated.
However, depending on the region, stringed instruments etc are also incorporated.
sen.cmt: 全角表記を半角に修正、スペース追加

sen.j: また、神輿に太鼓を結びつけ、その太鼓のみを打つ場合もある。
sen.e: Also， the drum is closely linked with `Mikoshi` portable festival shrines and is in some cases the only drum used.
Also， the drum is closely linked with `Mikoshi` portable festival shrines and is in some cases the only drum used.
Also, the drum is closely linked with Mikoshi portable festival shrines and is in some cases the only drum used.
sen.cmt: 全角表記を半角に修正、クォーテーション削除

sen.j: また謡が入る場合や木遣り(手古舞)と合わさる場合、掛け声が入る場合もある。
sen.e: Furthermore, in cases when Noh chanting is an element and incorporated along with workman's work chants (festival dances), shouts of encouragement are sometimes included in proceedings.
Furthermore, in cases when Noh chanting is an element and incorporated along with workman's work chants (festival dances), shouts of encouragement are sometimes included in proceedings.

Furthermore, in cases when Noh chanting is an element and incorporated along with Kiyari (workman's work chants) (Tekomai (float leading dance)), shouts of encouragement are sometimes included in proceedings.
sen.cmt: スペースを半角に修正、workman‘s→workman'sに修正、「木遣り(手古舞)」の表記を修正 (用語集参照)

tit.cmt: &→andに修正、頭文字を大文字に変更、ピリオド削除

sen.j: 祭囃子は祭の行事に伴って演奏されるため、行事の形態により演奏形態や服装も異なる。
sen.e: `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) is designed to be performed with festival events and as such, the shape of performances and performers' costumes can vary depending on the nature of the event.
`Matsuribayashi' (festival music) is designed to be performed with festival events and as such, the shape of performances and performers' costumes can vary depending on the nature of the event.
Matsuribayashi is designed to be performed with festival events and as such, the shape of performances and performers' costumes can vary depending on the nature of the event.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを半角に修正、`Matsuribayashi’ (festival music) →Matsuribayashiとしました。

sen.j: 神社内で祭が行われる場合、境内にある能舞台、神楽殿等で演奏される。
sen.e: For festivals taking place within shrines, performances take place on stage areas within the temple grounds and in dedicated temple halls used for music.
For festivals taking place within shrines, performances take place on stage areas within the temple grounds and in dedicated temple halls used for music.
For festivals taking place within shrines, performances take place on stage areas within the temple grounds and in dedicated temple halls used for music.

sen.j: また、集落内に舞台を作り演奏される場合もある。
sen.e: Also, in some cases performances take place on a stage that is built in the local community.
Also, in some cases performances take place on a stage that is built in the local community.
Also, in some cases performances take place on a stage that is built in the local community.

sen.j: 祭の行事に行列がある場合はそれに加わり歩きながら演奏する。
sen.e: For festival events that require participants to stand in lines, performers sometimes play while walking along and blending in.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: For festival events that require participants to stand in lines, performers sometimes play while walking along and blending in.
For festival events that require participants to stand in lines, performers sometimes play while walking along and blending in.

sen.j: 山車、屋台などが出る場合はそこに乗り込み演奏する。
sen.e: Ｗhen festiｖal floats and carts appear, these are in some cases ridden and performed upon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ｗhen festiｖal floats and carts appear, these are in some cases ridden and performed upon.
When festival float and carts appear, these are in some cases ridden and performed upon.
sen.cmt: 全角表記を半角に修正

sen.j: 演奏するときには半天(半纏、袢纏、法被)など派手な和服を着ることが多い。
sen.e: Performers often wear gaudy traditional Japanese `happi` coats when performing.
Performers often wear gaudy traditional Japanese `happi` coats when performing.
Performers often wear gaudy traditional Japanese 'happi' coats when performing.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正

sen.j: また、地域によっては厚化粧をする場合もある。
sen.e: Also, depending on the region, some performers wear heavy makeup.
Also, depending on the region, some performers wear heavy makeup.
Also, depending on the region, some performers wear heavy makeup.

sen.j: これには先述の奏法の違いや奏者の兼任する職業なども影響している。
sen.e: As mentioned before, this may also depend on the instrument being played as well as the type of employment concurrently held by the performer.
As mentioned before, this may also depend on the instrument being played as well as the type of employment concurrently held by the performer.
As mentioned before, this may also depend on the instrument being played as well as the type of employment concurrently held by the performer.

sen.j: 起源はそれぞれの祭囃子が伝承されている地域や団体によって異なる。
sen.e: The origins of each type of `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) varies depending on the traditions in regions and organizations involved.
The origins of each type of `Matsuribayashi' (festival music) varies depending on the traditions in regions and organizations involved.
The origions of each type of Matsuribayashi varies depending on the traditions in regions and organizations involved.
sen.cmt: 全角表記を半角に修正、`Matsuribayashi’ (festival music) →Matsuribayashiとしました。

sen.j: 関東地方では鎌倉起源説、伊勢起源説があるが、どちらの説も確定のための検証はされていない。
sen.e: It is noted as having originated in Kamakura (in the Kanto region of Japan) and Ise, however, neither explanation stands up to definite scrutiny.
It is noted as having originated in Kamakura (in the Kanto region of Japan) and Ise, however, neither explanation stands up to definite scrutiny.
It is noted as having originated in Kamakura (in the Kanto region of Japan) and Ise; however, neither explanation stands up to definite scrutiny.
sen.cmt: howeverの前のカンマをセミコロンに変更
